Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of military scene; part of one leg in added white, wearing a greave outlined with white dots, running to left, and overlapped by bare right foot of second figure also running left; below, two dilute lines.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The clay is highly micacous and light-brown/beige.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 88, pl. X, no. 18) (mislabelled G.131.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.007) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
